text:
John Stanley Carroll (born December 18, 1929) is an American politician. He was a state representative and state senator from Hawaii as a Republican. He was born in St. Marys, Kansas.
In 1966 Carroll ran for one of Hawaii's two at-large congressional district seats, but came in third place behind incumbents Patsy Mink and Spark Matsunaga.
On June 14, 2019 he announced that he would run for mayor of Honolulu.
